title: Environment Variables
content:
What they are

Environment variables are key/value pairs available to processes. They configure program behavior and are inherited by child processes.

Common variables

  • HOME: your home directory
  • PATH: where the shell searches for executables
  • SHELL: your current shell
echo "$HOME"
echo "$PATH" | tr ':' '\n' | head
printenv | head

Setting and exporting

MYVAR="hello"
echo "$MYVAR"
export MYVAR

Profiles

Shell startup files load variables and aliases (e.g., ~/.zshrc, ~/.bashrc, ~/.profile).
